alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 25 at 10:13PM PST until December 30 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM THURSDAY TO 9 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 10 to 13 feet with dangerous rip currents. Local sets to 15 feet tonight. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large and potentially damaging breaking waves of 17 to 22 feet with local sets to 25 feet are likely, along with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 3 AM PST Thursday. For the High Surf Warning, from 3 AM Thursday to 9 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Powerful waves and strong rip currents will pose an exceptional risk of ocean drowning and damage to coastal structures like piers and jetties, especially Thursday through Saturday. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest surf will be across west facing beaches. Coastal flooding and beach erosion will likely be more significant Thursday through Saturday, especially during times of high tide. A coastal flood advisory will likely need to be issued as we draw closer to the event due to this increased risk of more significant coastal flood impacts. This very large surf combined with relatively high tides of 5.7 to 6.4 feet may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other water side infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
